description.zh-cn: 1928年6月4日，由日本关东军策划，在沈阳皇姑屯附近炸毁奉系军阀首领张作霖乘坐的专列，将其暗杀的事件。
description.en: An event on June 4, 1928, planned by the Japanese Kwantung Army, in which the special train carrying Zhang Zuolin, the leader of the Fengtian clique, was bombed and he was assassinated near Huanggutun, Shenyang.

description.zh-cn: 中国奉系军阀首领，北洋政府最后一任统治者。在从北京返回奉天途中，于皇姑屯事件中被日本关东军暗杀。
description.en: Leader of the Chinese Fengtian clique and the last ruler of the Beiyang Government. He was assassinated by the Japanese Kwantung Army in the Huanggutun Incident while returning to Fengtian from Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国陆军的一支部队，驻扎在中国东北。因不满张作霖未能履行对日承诺，私自策划并执行了皇姑屯事件。
description.en: A unit of the Imperial Japanese Army stationed in Northeast China. Dissatisfied with Zhang Zuolin's failure to fulfill his promises to Japan, it independently planned and executed the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 日本关东军高级参谋、陆军大佐，皇姑屯事件的具体策划者和主要责任人。
description.en: A senior staff officer and Colonel in the Japanese Kwantung Army, the specific planner and main person responsible for the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀高级将领，时任黑龙江督军。在皇姑屯事件中与张作霖同乘一列火车，当场身亡。
description.en: A senior general of the Fengtian clique, serving as the military governor of Heilongjiang. He was on the same train as Zhang Zuolin during the Huanggutun Incident and was killed instantly.

description.zh-cn: 张作霖之子。在其父死后，稳定了东北局势并继承其职务，后宣布东北易帜。
description.en: Son of Zhang Zuolin. After his father's death, he stabilized the situation in Northeast China, succeeded to his position, and later announced the Northeast Flag Replacement.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期的军阀集团之一，以张作霖为首，长期统治中国东北地区。
description.en: One of the warlord cliques during the Republic of China era, led by Zhang Zuolin, which controlled Northeast China for a long period.

description.zh-cn: 1912年至1928年间代表中国的合法政府，张作霖是其最后一任统治者。
description.en: The legitimate government of China from 1912 to 1928. Zhang Zuolin was its last ruler.

description.zh-cn: 由张作霖在北京建立的军政府，他自任陆海军大元帅，代表北洋政府行使统治权。
description.en: A military government established by Zhang Zuolin in Beijing, where he assumed the title of Grand Marshal of the Army and Navy, exercising ruling power on behalf of the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党于1925年至1947年间的国家武装力量。其发动的北伐战争直接导致张作霖势力退回东北。
description.en: The national armed forces of the Kuomintang from 1925 to 1947. Its Northern Expedition directly led to the retreat of Zhang Zuolin's forces to the Northeast.

description.zh-cn: 由国民革命军发动的统一中国的军事行动，其攻势迫使张作霖的奉军撤出北京，返回东北。
description.en: A military campaign launched by the National Revolutionary Army to unify China. Its offensive forced Zhang Zuolin's Fengtian army to withdraw from Beijing and return to the Northeast.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本关东军司令官，中将。下令执行了暗杀张作霖的计划。
description.en: The commander of the Japanese Kwantung Army at the time, with the rank of Lieutenant General. He ordered the execution of the plan to assassinate Zhang Zuolin.

description.zh-cn: 日本关东军奉天特务机关长，参与策划了皇姑屯事件。
description.en: Head of the Japanese Kwantung Army's Fengtian special intelligence agency, who participated in the planning of the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军将领，参与策划了皇姑屯事件。
description.en: A general in the Imperial Japanese Army who participated in the planning of the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 皇姑屯事件发生时的日本首相。据信他因对该事件处理不当，引起天皇不满而被迫辞职。
description.en: Prime Minister of Japan at the time of the Huanggutun Incident. It is believed that he was forced to resign due to the Emperor's dissatisfaction with his handling of the incident.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间的日本国号。其关东军为了保障在满洲的利益而发动了皇姑屯事件。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947. Its Kwantung Army initiated the Huanggutun Incident to secure its interests in Manchuria.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的武装力量。1949年在太原战役后俘获了作为日本战犯的河本大作。
description.en: The armed forces of the People's Republic of China. It captured Daisaku Kōmoto as a Japanese war criminal after the Taiyuan Campaign in 1949.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期山西军阀。日本投降后，皇姑屯事件主谋河本大作曾投靠于他。
description.en: A warlord in Shanxi during the Republic of China era. After Japan's surrender, Daisaku Kōmoto, the mastermind of the Huanggutun Incident, took refuge with him.

en: International Military Tribunal for the Far East

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战后，设于日本东京的国际军事法庭，负责审判日本战犯。该法庭将皇姑屯事件视为日本侵华的起点。
description.en: An international military tribunal established in Tokyo, Japan, after World War II to try Japanese war criminals. The tribunal considered the Huanggutun Incident as the starting point of Japan's invasion of China.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀成员，与张作霖同乘一列火车，在皇姑屯事件中受伤。
description.en: A member of the Fengtian clique who was on the same train as Zhang Zuolin and was injured in the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，与张作霖同乘一列火车，在皇姑屯事件中受伤。
description.en: A Chinese politician who was on the same train as Zhang Zuolin and was injured in the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 关东军因不满张作霖未能履行对日承诺，策划并执行了皇姑屯事件，将其暗杀。
description.en: Dissatisfied with Zhang Zuolin's failure to fulfill promises to Japan, the Kwantung Army planned and executed the Huanggutun Incident, assassinating him.

description.zh-cn: 张作霖乘坐的专列在皇姑屯事件中被炸毁，其本人被炸成重伤，送回沈阳后不治身亡。
description.en: Zhang Zuolin's special train was bombed in the Huanggutun Incident; he was severely injured and died after being sent back to Shenyang.

description.zh-cn: 吴俊升在皇姑屯事件中当场死亡。
description.en: Wu Junsheng was killed instantly in the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军的北伐攻势导致张作霖的奉军无法抵挡，被迫通电求和并乘火车撤回沈阳。
description.en: The Northern Expedition's offensive by the National Revolutionary Army overwhelmed Zhang Zuolin's Fengtian army, forcing him to sue for peace and retreat to Shenyang by train.

description.zh-cn: 作为北洋政府的最高统治者，张作霖的奉军与国民革命军在北伐战争中是敌对关系。
description.en: As the supreme ruler of the Beiyang Government, Zhang Zuolin's Fengtian army was hostile to the National Revolutionary Army during the Northern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 张作霖是奉系军阀的最高领袖。
description.en: Zhang Zuolin was the supreme leader of the Fengtian clique.

description.zh-cn: 1927年6月18日，张作霖在北京建立了安国军政府，并自任陆海军大元帅。
description.en: On June 18, 1927, Zhang Zuolin established the Anguojun Government in Beijing and appointed himself Grand Marshal of the Army and Navy.

description.zh-cn: 张作霖是北洋政府最后一任实际统治者。
description.en: Zhang Zuolin was the last de facto ruler of the Beiyang Government.

description.zh-cn: 张学良是张作霖之子。
description.en: Zhang Xueliang is the son of Zhang Zuolin.

description.zh-cn: 作为关东军高级参谋，具体制定了暗杀张作霖的详细计划。
description.en: As a senior staff officer of the Kwantung Army, he formulated the detailed plan for assassinating Zhang Zuolin.

description.zh-cn: 作为时任关东军司令官，下达了执行皇姑屯事件的命令。
description.en: As the then commander of the Kwantung Army, he gave the order to carry out the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 日本首相田中义一因处理皇姑屯事件的方式引起天皇不满，被认为是其最终辞职的原因之一。
description.en: Japanese Prime Minister Tanaka Giichi's handling of the Huanggutun Incident caused dissatisfaction with the Emperor, which is considered one of the reasons for his eventual resignation.

description.zh-cn: 在1946年开始的审判中，远东国际军事法庭将皇姑屯事件视为日本侵华战争的起点。
description.en: In the trials beginning in 1946, the International Military Tribunal for the Far East regarded the Huanggutun Incident as the starting point of Japan's war of aggression against China.

description.zh-cn: 1949年，中国人民解放军在攻取太原后，将河本大作作为日本战犯逮捕。
description.en: In 1949, after capturing Taiyuan, the Chinese People's Liberation Army arrested Daisaku Kōmoto as a Japanese war criminal.

description.zh-cn: 1945年日本投降后，河本大作投靠阎锡山并为其工作，直至1949年被俘。
description.en: After Japan's surrender in 1945, Daisaku Kōmoto took refuge with and worked for Yan Xishan until he was captured in 1949.

description.zh-cn: 与张作霖同乘一列专列，在皇姑屯事件中一同遇袭。
description.en: Traveled on the same special train as Zhang Zuolin and was attacked with him in the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 与张作霖同乘一列专列，在皇姑屯事件中受伤。
description.en: Traveled on the same special train as Zhang Zuolin and was injured in the Huanggutun Incident.

description.zh-cn: 与张作霖同乘一列专列，在皇姑屯事件中受伤。
description.en: Traveled on the same special train as Zhang Zuolin and was injured in the Huanggutun Incident.
